reviews.text:
Guoco Tower is a skyscraper located in the Tanjong Pagar area of Singapore. It is the tallest building in Singapore, standing at 290 meters (951 feet) with 64 floors. Completed in 2016, it is part of an integrated mixed-use development that includes office spaces, luxury residences (Wallich Residence), a hotel (Sofitel Singapore City Centre), retail outlets, and urban park spaces.

Key features of Guoco Tower:

1. Mixed-Use Development: Combines residential, commercial, retail, and hospitality components.

2. Wallich Residence: Ultra-luxury apartments occupying the upper levels of the tower.

3. Office Space: Premium Grade A offices, including the headquarters of various multinational corporations.

4. Hotel: Sofitel Singapore City Centre is located within the tower.

5. Connectivity: Directly linked to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, making it highly accessible.

6. Amenities: Retail shops, dining options, urban park spaces, and more.
Beautiful tower and many good food within this building.

Very horrible management team with rude and unreasonable security guard! One of the worst i ever come acrossâ€¦. Instead of helping and assisting you, they expect you to go find out all by yourself even though the security saw you walking round looking for them! Even admitted they saw u looking for them when finally spoke with them! Arrogant attitude!

We happen to be here many time, as it is connected with Tanjong Pagar MRT Station.

We like Welcia-BHG and  Kuriya Japanese Market. There are many specialty store around B2.
Favourite office location with all amenities for work and personal
